usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: The script instantiates BeamCut objects and calls addMeToGenBeamsIntersect() to physically modify the wall geometry (holes and wirechases). It uses _Element to reference a selected wall. There is no sd_ prefix, no _Viewport usage, and no #Type E entity arrays typical of ShopDrawing scripts.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: Requires a Wall Element selected in Model Space.

```json
{
  "scriptPurpose": {
    "summary": "Creates electrical installation boxes and vertical wire chases (routing) in timber wall elements, generating necessary cuts/milling and visualization data for production and shop drawings.",
    "category": "Hardware",
    "typicalUseCase": "Used during the design or detailing phase to specify locations for electrical outlets, switches, and data points in wall panels, ensuring the timber framing is pre-cut for installation."
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "dHeightFinishedFloor",
      "technicalDefault": "U(190)",
      "businessMeaning": "The elevation of the finished floor surface relative to the bottom of the wall structure (soleplate bottom). All installation heights are calculated relative to this reference level.",
      "validRange": "0 - 500 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Offsets the vertical placement (Y-axis relative to local wall coord system) of all installation boxes and wire chase origins. Changes where holes appear in the wall."
    },
    {
      "name": "dHeightSoleplate",
      "technicalDefault": "U(38)",
      "businessMeaning": "The height/thickness of the bottom plate (soleplate) of the wall element.",
      "validRange": "38 - 100 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Defines the lower boundary for the wall's finishable area. Used to calculate the absolute Z position of the installation boxes from the structural bottom."
    },
    {
      "name": "sSubType",
      "technicalDefault": "\"\"",
      "businessMeaning": "A user-defined classification label (e.g., 'A', 'B', 'Living Room') used to group or filter these installation points during dimensioning or scheduling.",
      "validRange": "String text",
      "unit": "text",
      "affectsOutput": "Written to the 'DimInfo' map for interaction with other scripts (like HSB_D-Element). Does not directly alter geometry, but affects data export or dimensioning."
    },
    {
      "name": "sQuantity",
      "technicalDefault": "\"1\"",
      "businessMeaning": "The number of electrical boxes to create at a specific height level. Multiple values separated by semicolons allow different counts for different heights.",
      "validRange": "Integer (e.g., 1, 2, 3)",
      "unit": "count",
      "affectsOutput": "Determines how many holes are cut horizontally at the specific height index. Controls the number of `_PtG` points generated."
    },
    {
      "name": "sHeight",
      "technicalDefault": "\"1100\"",
      "businessMeaning": "The vertical elevation of the electrical box center, measured from the finished floor. Multiple values separated by semicolons support multiple rows of boxes.",
      "validRange": "100 - 3000 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the vertical Y-position of the installation holes relative to the finished floor."
    },
    {
      "name": "sTag",
      "technicalDefault": "\"Type1\"",
      "businessMeaning": "A specific label or code (e.g., 'S1' for Switch, 'P1' for Plug) displayed in drawings to identify the fixture type.",
      "validRange": "String text",
      "unit": "text",
      "affectsOutput": "Updates the text label drawn in the Plan view display (dpPlan)."
    },
    {
      "name": "dDiameter",
      "technicalDefault": "U(69)",
      "businessMeaning": "The diameter of the circular hole (or width of the box opening) required for the electrical back-box.",
      "validRange": "60 - 100 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Defines the width of the cylindrical BeamCut created for the box. Affects the horizontal spacing calculation."
    },
    {
      "name": "dDepth",
      "technicalDefault": "U(50)",
      "businessMeaning": "The depth of the electrical box, indicating how deep the machining/milling needs to go into the wall from the finished surface.",
      "validRange": "30 - 80 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Defines the depth of the cylindrical BeamCut (penetration into the wall) and the 'Extra mill' depth adjustments."
    },
    {
      "name": "dBetweenInstallations",
      "technicalDefault": "U(71)",
      "businessMeaning": "The center-to-center distance between multiple boxes placed at the same height.",
      "validRange": "60 - 200 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Calculates the horizontal offset for subsequent boxes in a multi-box row."
    },
    {
      "name": "sInstallationTypes",
      "technicalDefault": "\"\"",
      "businessMeaning": "A read-only summary string listing the specific electrical types assigned to each box (e.g., '1-Switch/10A;'). Managed via the external 'Set installation types' dialog.",
      "validRange": "String (Read-only)",
      "unit": "text",
      "affectsOutput": "Drives the text displayed in the Elevation view (dpElevation). Stored in the Map 'Installations' for downstream processing."
    },
    {
      "name": "dWidthExtra

workflowDiagram: Script launched/Insert command started
Check if inserted with execute key (Catalog preset)
[Conditional] If execute key valid: Load properties from catalog
[Conditional] If no execute key: Show internal configuration dialog (ShowDialog)
Prompt user to select a Wall Element (getElement)
Validate selected element is a Wall (ElementWall)
[Conditional] If invalid: Report warning, prompt again to select valid wall
Prompt user to select Insertion Point (getPoint)
Calculate position relative to Soleplate and Finished Floor
Parse quantity and height strings (semicolon separated)
Generate Installation Points (_PtG) based on quantities and offsets
Validate Extra Mill dimensions (>0 check)
Create Box Cuts (BeamCuts) at each generated point
Validate Wire Chase dimensions (>0 check)
Calculate Wire Chase geometry (Alignment, Direction, Max Height constraints)
Create Wire Chase Cut (BeamCut)
Apply cuts to intersecting GenBeams in the Wall (addMeToGenBeamsIntersect)
Check for existing Installation Types in internal Map
[Conditional] If mismatch in point count or context trigger: Open External Dialog (HSB_P-AssignInstallationType)
Update read-only 'Installation types' string property from Map
Generate Visuals (Plan and Elevation text) with tags and heights
Set SubType to DimInfo Map for export/scheduling

path1.name: Catalog Preset
steps: Load properties (sizes, tags, etc.) from catalog

path2.name: Manual Configuration
steps: Execute key is empty or not found

path1.name: Left or Right Side
steps: User selects 'Left' or 'Right' in sSideWireChase property
Wire chase origin offset by -0.5 * Diameter horizontally

path2.name: Aligned
steps: Wire chase origin offset vertically by 0.5 * Diameter

path1.name: Up
steps: Calculate length from MinHeight to Top of Wall (+40mm)

path2.name: Down
steps: Standard length calculation from MaxHeight to Soleplate
No specific direction logic triggered in code (implies default)

path3.name: Up and down
steps: Origin centered at Panel Center Y
Length set to full Panel Height + 40mm

path1.name: Single Point / Single Height
steps: sQuantity and sHeight contain single values
One hole cut at specified height/offset

path2.name: Multiple Points / Heights
steps: Inner loop iterates through quantities at that height
Multiple holes created and visualization added

validationRules.errorMessage: "Invalid element selected. A wall is required."
validationRules.recovery: Script prompts user again to select a valid wall using getElement().
Script exits (return) without creating geometry if the wall envelope calculation fails.
If Width, Height, or Depth Extra Mill <= 0, the extra mill BeamCut is skipped entirely.
If Width, Length, or Depth Wire Chase <= 0, the wire chase BeamCut is skipped.
If internal Map 'Installations' does not match the number of generated points (_PtG), or 'Set installation types' context menu is used, the assignment dialog is forced to open.

postInsertionActions.effect: Recalculates hole size, depth, and wire chase size immediately on recalc.
Re-parses strings, regenerates the array of installation points (_PtG), creates/cuts new holes, removes old ones. May trigger the 'Assign Installation Types' dialog if point count changes.
Opens external 'HSB_P-AssignInstallationType' dialog. Updates the internal 'Installations' Map and the read-only 'sInstallationTypes' property string.
Moves all associated boxes and wire chases relative to the new insertion point, maintaining offsets relative to the wall.

data.markdown:
# HSB_P-InstallationPoint.mcr

## Overview
This script allows you to insert electrical installation boxes (outlets, switches) and vertical wire chases into timber wall elements. It automatically generates the necessary CNC cuts/milling and visual data for production and shop drawings.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | Script must be inserted on a Wall Element in the model. |
| Paper Space | No | Not applicable. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Not applicable. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: A Wall Element (`ElementWall`) must exist in the drawing.
- **Minimum Beams**: 0 (Operates on the Element/Panel level).
- **Required Settings**: The script `HSB_P-AssignInstallationType.mcr` must be available in the TSL search path to assign specific electrical types.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
**Command**: `TSLINSERT`
**Action**: Browse the catalog and select `HSB_P-InstallationPoint.mcr`.

### Step 2: Select Wall
```
Command Line: Select a wall
Action: Click on the Wall Element where you want to place the installation.
```

### Step 3: Define Insertion Point
```
Command Line: [Point prompt]
Action: Click on the wall to define the location of the first installation box.
```

### Step 4: Configure Properties (Optional)
- If you insert the script without an "Execute Key" (preset), a configuration dialog will appear automatically.
- You can also change settings later via the Properties Palette (Ctrl+1).

### Step 5: Assign Electrical Types (Optional)
- Right-click the script instance and select **Set installation types**.
- This opens a dialog to define specific types (e.g., "Switch", "Socket") for each box.

## Properties Panel Parameters

### General settings
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Height finished floor | Number | 190 mm | The elevation of the finished floor. Installation heights are measured from this level. |
| Height soleplate | Number | 38 mm | The height of the wall's bottom plate. |
| Sub type | Text | | A user-defined label to differentiate points (e.g., for filtering in dimension lines). |

### Installation
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Quantity | Text | 1 | Number of boxes. Use semicolons for different quantities per height (e.g., "1;2"). |
| Height from finished floor | Text | 1100 | Vertical position of the box. Use semicolons for multiple rows (e.g., "300;1200"). |
| Tag | Text | Type1 | Label displayed in drawings (e.g., "S1", "P1"). |
| Diameter | Number | 69 mm | Diameter of the hole for the back-box. |
| Depth | Number | 50 mm | Depth of the box machining into the wall. |
| Offset between installations | Number | 71 mm | Center-to-center distance for multiple boxes on the same row. |
| Installation types | Text | | (Read-only) Summary of assigned electrical types. Updated via the Right-Click menu. |

### Extra mill
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Width extra mill | Number | 40 mm | Additional milling width around the box. |
| Height extra mill | Number | 40 mm | Additional milling height around the box. |
| Depth extra mill | Number | 50 mm | Additional milling depth around the box. |

### Wire chase
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Side wire chase | Dropdown | Left | Side of the wire chase relative to the box (Left, Right, or Aligned). |
| Direction wire chase | Dropdown | Up | Direction of the vertical chase (Up, Down, or Up and down). |
| Maximum height wire chase | Number | 0 mm | Limits the vertical length. 0 allows the chase to go to the top/bottom of the wall. |
| Width wire chase | Number | 30 mm | Width of the vertical chase cut. |
| Depth wire chase | Number | 30 mm | Depth of the vertical chase cut. |

### Display
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Dimension style | Text | _DimStyles | The visual style used for dimensions in the drawing. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Set installation types | Opens a dialog to assign specific electrical types (e.g., Switch, Data, Plug) to the generated installation points. |

## Settings Files
- **Dependency**: `HSB_P-AssignInstallationType.mcr`
- **Location**: TSL Script Path
- **Purpose**: Provides the dialog interface and logic for assigning detailed electrical types to the points created by this script.

## Tips
- **Multiple Rows**: To create multiple rows of outlets at different heights, use semicolons in the **Height** and **Quantity** fields (e.g., Height: `300;1200`, Quantity: `2;1`).
- **Reference Level**: Remember that the **Height from finished floor** is relative to the **Height finished floor** parameter, not the absolute bottom of the wall structure.
- **Moving Points**: You can move the entire group of installations by using the grip edit point on the script instance.
- **Visualization**: The script updates plan and elevation views automatically. Ensure your "Dim Style" matches your project standards.

## FAQ
- **Q: How do I place two sockets next to each other at the same height?**
  A: Set **Quantity** to `2` and adjust the **Offset between installations** to the desired distance.
- **Q: Why didn't my wire chase go all the way to the top?**
  A: Check the **Maximum height wire chase** setting. If it is set to `0`, it should go to the top. If set to a specific value, it will stop at that height relative to the origin.
- **Q: The hole seems too low/high compared to my floor.**
  A: Check the **Height finished floor** parameter. If you have floor finishes, this value needs to be accurate so the calculations start from the correct Z-level.
